page.title: 06FARMING CHANGES
page.content:
Over time small crofts have been collected to-gether to make larger farms. This means that fewer people are working on the land. Fewer houses have been needed so slowly the number of houses lying disused increased. Some unused buildings have been bought and turned into modern homes. The Government's grants have helped people to 'do up' houses which might have gone to waste.
Mechanisation has meant that fewer people can do more work. One farmer said he can do almost all his work in his tractor.
The usual 'square' bales have almost disappeared from this block, & have been replaced by the new big 'round' bales.
